subject: Test template
msgSnippet: ... fail( Not yet implemented ); ... I just added a line of code you might like in all your tests. Don t remove the fail() statement until you re certain
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> When writing test cases my fingers automatically type:
>
> public void testTheMethodBeingTested() throws Exception {
fail("Not yet implemented");
> }

I just added a line of code you might like in all your tests. Don't
remove the fail() statement until you're certain you've written the test
correctly. It avoids false positives.

Better yet, import this code template into Eclipse:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<templates>
<template id="org.eclipse.jdt.ui.templates.test" name="test"
description="test method" context="java" enabled="true"
deleted="false">public void test${name}() throws Exception {
${cursor}
fail("Not yet implemented");
}</template>
</templates>

--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
